results.question: How does a non-employee director receive his/her restricted stock unit award or option grant?
gold_answer: on the date of his or her initial appointment to the Board of Directors equal to the pro-rated amount of the annual grant
results.markdown_table_response: The board of directors of a publicly traded corporation must determine what amounts to a reasonable compensation for the services of our non-employee directors, considering the company’s overall performance and the performance of the non-employee directors. The board must then determine the fair value of the restricted stock unit award or option grant on the date of the grant, and then apply the fair value to the fair market value of the restricted stock unit award or option grant on the date of grant. Basic earnings per share, or EPS, is calculated by dividing net income (loss) by the weighted-average number of common shares outstanding for the period, without consideration for common stock equivalents. Diluted EPS is computed by dividing net income by the weighted-average number of common shares outstanding for the period and the weighted-average number of dilutive common stock equivalents outstanding for the period determined using the treasury-stock method.
For purposes of this calculation, common stock options, restricted stock units and restricted stock awards are considered to be common stock equivalents and are only included in the calculation of diluted EPS when their effect is dilutive.
